title: Mamdani Vows to Govern ‘Audaciously’ and Protect New York’s Vulnerable
summary: Zohran Mamdani gave his first public speech as mayor of New York City, after an inauguration that drew tens of thousands of people.

title: Mamdani Lays Out Agenda of ‘Affordability and Abundance’ on First Day in Office
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani acknowledged skeptics of his plans while reiterating that he would focus on working-class New Yorkers.

title: Mamdani’s First Orders Focus on Housing and Undoing Adams’s Decisions
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani signed a flurry of executive orders on his first day as mayor of New York City. They were aimed at protecting tenants and revoking some of ex-Mayor Eric Adams’s past orders.

title: Fire in Swiss Alps Leaves Dozens of New Year’s Revelers Dead
summary: About 40 people celebrating at a ski resort bar were killed, and 115 were injured, many of them young, the authorities said.

title: Witnesses Recount Fire That Killed 40 in Switzerland
summary: It was a haven for the young, where they could find hot chocolate when they wanted quiet and affordable drinks when they did not. Then it turned into a place of death.

title: Switzerland’s burn centers are so overwhelmed that fire victims are being sent to other countries.
Swiss Alps Ski Resort Fire: What We Know
summary: The fire at a bar in a popular ski resort killed around 40 people and injured more than 100, officials said. The cause was still unknown.

title: In China, A.I. Finds Pancreatic Cancer That Doctors May Miss
summary: A tool for spotting pancreatic cancer in routine CT scans has had promising results, one example of how China is racing to apply A.I. to medicine’s tough problems.

title: Toby Morton, a Comedy Writer, Owns the Trump Kennedy Center URL
summary: A comedy writer bought the web domain TrumpKennedyCenter.org and the satirical site he created is drawing attention amid the backlash over the institution’s renaming.

title: Russia Asks United States to Stop Pursuit of Fleeing Oil Tanker
summary: The tanker, which had been sailing to Venezuela to pick up oil, has claimed Russian protection, although the U.S. authorities say it is a stateless vessel.

title: Venezuela Frees Dozens of Political Prisoners
summary: At least 80 people were released, including one with U.S. ties, though more than 800 remain detained in Venezuela for opposing President Nicolás Maduro’s rule, rights groups say.

title: Can the Most Indebted Team in Global Soccer Fix Its Finances?
summary: F.C. Barcelona’s liabilities have reached 2.5 billion euros, the result of financial mismanagement and vaulting ambition.

title: For Some Nazi Loot, Value Is Measured on a Different Scale
summary: Heirs of families that suffered in the Holocaust have gotten back precious items: not treasured art, but the keepsakes of dead relatives.

title: Iran Protests Turn Deadly as Violence and Anger Spread
summary: Financial pressures have fueled a fifth day of demonstrations around Iran, with at least one person killed in the protests so far, according to the authorities.

title: Janet Fish, Painter of Luminous Still Lifes, Dies at 87
summary: From her student days, she stubbornly refused to follow popular artistic trends. Instead, she spent decades exploring the effects of light on glass.

title: This Diminutive Reptile Plays Rock-Paper-Scissors
summary: Side-blotched lizards probably don’t call the game that, but they play a version of it anyway. A new study explains the hidden biology that makes this possible.

title: ‘Visible Mending’: The Healing Powers of Knitting
summary: Crafters across Britain speak to how knitting can help us heal, even at our most broken.

title: Why New York City Needs Someone Like Mamdani
summary: The new mayor is an entirely familiar type of New York politician.

title: How Japanese Scallops Became a Pawn in Diplomatic Tensions With China
summary: Beijing is using a ban on the humble mollusk to punish Japan over its apparent willingness to defend Taiwan.

title: Search Is Suspended for Passenger Who Went Overboard From Cruise Ship
summary: The U.S. Coast Guard said on Thursday that it halted its hourslong search for a 77-year-old woman who went overboard from a Holland America Line cruise ship near Cuba.

title: Guinea’s Coup Leader Wins Election After Barring Leading Opponents
summary: Gen. Mamady Doumbouya, who seized power more than four years ago, took over 80 percent of the vote, according to a government-controlled agency that he set up.
